subject: RE: [junit] Strange request: examples of "beautiful" test code
msgSnippet: In my book, a beautiful unit test is one that tests as much as possible, as simply as possible.  I don t usually associate clever with keep is simple
messageBody:
In my book, a beautiful unit test is one that tests as much as possible,
as simply as possible. I don't usually associate "clever" with "keep is
simple stupid" but maybe that's just me. I think a beautiful JUnit test
would be one that uses both inheritance and the "parameterized test
case" pattern to be as short and sweet (and therefore maintainable) as
possible. But that just this beholder's eye.


Todd.

> I have been invited to contribute an article for a book that
> covers examples of beautiful code (those of you who have been
> programming for quite a while might remember the great book
> "Programming Pearls" - this is along the same lines.) The
> "catch" is that I have to contribute testing-related examples
> - in other words: beautiful test code.
>
> I already have some ideas of what to cover, but I thought
> some of the people in this group might have some examples of
> tests that they consider particularly "beautiful" or clever
> in their approach.
>
> I think it's great that developer testing has reached the
> point that some authors/editors thought of including testing
> in such a book, and I want to make sure I pick the best
> possible example(s) to pick from.
